message.content:
cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.CV, cs.CY, cs.NE

This paper presents a new dataset for human activity recognition using acceleration data from smartphones. The dataset is designed for machine learning-based algorithms, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the dataset is focused on monitoring human activities, which could also place it in the sub-category of cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). The paper also mentions the use of feature vectors and classifiers, which could suggest a connection to the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). The dataset includes information on age and gender, which could suggest a connection to the sub-category of cs.CY (Computers and Society). Finally, the paper evaluates the dataset using different classifiers and feature vectors, which could suggest a connection to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
